nodes.bodyText: so if (vlanId == 4095) we set the range and  vlanId but if (vlanId == null) we don't care about the set range. is this intentional?

@DaanHoogland Yes the 4095 vlan ID is used a magic no. to create a trunked port group; this already exists for other hypervisors like kvm - https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CLOUDSTACK/Enable+vlan+4095+%27tag+passthrough%27+for+KVM

yes, i understand the function of vlandId == 4095 but my point is that it will be possible to pass vlanId == null and range == '2-9,15-99,4000-4094' or even range == '4000-4095', and should we correct that combination of parameters?
maybe not relevant enough to this fix, never mind

@Spaceman1984 Have you tested this?
this method createDVPortVlanSpec() is called only when vlanId is null, so if check here is always 'false' and the underlying code never executes. Please check and try to fix this in the appropriate top level method in the call stack.
